title: Elgar Parishad-Maoist links case: Supreme Court grants six-week interim bail to activist Mahesh Raut on medical grounds
content: Mr. Raut’s counsel apprised the top court that he has been suffering from rheumatoid arthritis and required urgent medical attention

title: Enforcement Directorate summons former cricketer Robin Uthappa in betting app linked PMLA case
content: Uthappa, 39, has been asked to get recorded his statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) in a case linked to a platform named 1xBet

title: If only all cases are settled so expeditiously: Jairam Ramesh's dig after Supreme Court closes case against Vantara
content: If only all cases are dealt with and settled so expeditiously and categorically — of course, without this mysterious 'sealed cover' business, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Rains LIVE: Heavy rains cause floods in Dehradun’s Sahastradhara; two missing
content: Damage have been reported from Sahastradhara and Mal Devta in Dehradun, and also from Mussoorie, an official said.

title: Registration for ragi procurement in Karnataka to start by end of September: Agriculture Minister
content: Minister for Agriculture N. Cheluvarayaswamy said that the decision was taken in consultation with the CM in the wake of problems being faced by farmers due to delay in procurement of ragi in 2024

title: Boy sexually assaulted by 14 men in Kerala, eight arrested
content: A total of 14 persons, including an Education department officer, an RPF official, and a political leader, have been booked under POCSO Act

title: Ola, Uber, Rapido get provisional licences for bike taxi services in Mumbai
content: ANI Technologies Private Limited, Uber India Systems Private Limited, and Roppen Transportation Services Private Limited, the parent companies of Ola, Uber, and Rapido, respectively, have been given approval.

title: 28 injured as KSRTC Swift bus rams under-construction underpass at Cherthala in Kerala’s Alappuzha
content: Among the injured, 11 are reported to be in serious condition. Fire and Rescue Services personnel had to cut open the bus to rescue driver and conductor

title: Worker killed as compound wall collapses in Petbasheerabad
content: Tragic collapse at V Convention in Petbasheerabad leaves one dead and six injured, sparking investigation

title: Truck driver abduction: Ex-IAS probationer's mother unleashed dogs to scare cops, says official
content: The driver was rescued from Puja Khedkar’s house in Pune on September 14, within hours of the abduction, which took place on September 13 evening

title: Car driven by head constable runs over three minor brothers killing two
content: After the accident, the local people caught the car driver, identified as head constable Narender Kumar, and handed him over to police. They alleged that he was in an inebriated state

title: Great Nicobar project will displace tribal communities, threaten their survival: Jairam Ramesh
content: Jairam Ramesh argued “The fact that further impact studies have been mandated after the project has been granted clearance shows up its limitations”

title: CCI has not identified any conduct that denied market access to rivals, Meta tells NCLAT
content: NCLAT was hearing a petition by the tech giant, which challenged a penalty of ₹213.14 crore on the social media major for unfair business ways

title: ‘India is coming to the table’: White House Trade Advisor Peter Navarro
content: Trump’s trade advisor Navarro said in the interview that the countries are still negotiating on the trade issue, and are working on ‘trade barriers’

title: Devadasi survey begins in Karnataka amid confusion over documents to be provided
content: The third survey of devadasis in Karnataka commenced on Monday amid confusion over the list of documents sought by the government to establish the identity

title: Pilot unions and aviation regulator gear for clash over fatigue
content: Unions reject data driven method for monitoring pilot fatigue; say India not ready, calls it attempt to side-step Court ordered time limits on duty hours

title: Kolkata social workers call on journalists to protect child dignity and rights while reporting
content: At a media sensitisation meet, experts stress that reporting on children must balance public interest with privacy, consent, and long-term wellbeing

title: Bihar Minister announces laptops for top engineering, polytechnic students
content: At present, the award carries a medal, certificate, memento and cash reward of ₹5,000, ₹4,000 and ₹3,000 for students securing first, second and third position at state level in engineering and polytechnic colleges

title: More than 6 million children in Maharashtra have non-communicable diseases, say experts
content: The burden is not just medical but social and financial and parents are pushed into debt for recurring costs and children suffer isolation in schools, say doctors

title: Odisha attracted investment of ₹5.6 lakh crore, created 1.64 lakh jobs in 15 months, says CM
content: Foundation stones for 27 industrial projects across 12 districts entailing investment of ₹25,000 crore laid virtually by State CM Mohan Majhi

title: Normal rainfall during southwest monsoon in Chennai, says Regional Meteorological Centre
content: However, these numbers are not final and are bound to change since the end of the season is September 30. Meanwhile, the southwest monsoon began its withdrawal from Rajasthan on Sunday

title: Press Club of India asks A.P. Chief Minister to stop police from targeting journalists
content: Says media fraternity is concerned by what they called ‘systematic hounding’ of the editor and journalists of Sakshi newspaper by A.P. Police for publishing routine news

title: CCMB scientists crack cells’ secret to shape-shifting
content: When a cell needs to form a new shape or protrusion, it must generate a fresh meshwork of actin that pushes in the desired direction

title: Hyderabad floods: Parsigutta families escaped death by a whisker
content: Decrepit retaining wall, part of which lay as a heap of heavy boulders now, hardly protected their homes, because water oozed from the catch-pits and flowed as a current from upper regions

title: Tejashwi Yadav slams Bihar Minister for ‘assaulting’ Youtuber
content: The RJD leader alleged that the YouTuber, Dilip Kumar Sahani, was beaten up and abused by the Minister for asking questions on the poor condition of the roads

title: Haryana farmers protest against ‘inept’ handling of flood situation
content: They demanded immediate steps to remove water from the fields, increased compensation for damaged crops and houses, financial assistance to landless labourers, MGNREGS works, ration for displaced families and other relief measures

title: ITR filing deadline extended by a day to September 16
content: The extension in the ITR deadline came after chartered accountants and individuals took to social media to complain of glitches on the e-filing portal

title: As monsoon retreats, Kerala likely to see below-normal rainfall
content: The State has received a total of 1,612.6 mm of rainfall as of September 15 against the seasonal average of 1,888.2 mm of rain, a shortfall of 15%

title: Govt. names advisory and pastor welfare panels
content: Cardinal Antony Poola,  Metropolitan Archbishop of Hyderabad and Rev Reuben Mark, Moderator of Church of South India named members of Advisory panel

title: Newly proposed 30% export duty will further hurt Karnataka’s iron ore, steel sectors: FIMI
content: The Centre’s recent proposal to fix export duty on low-grade iron ore at 30% from the earlier 0% will only worsen the situation of both mining and steel production in Karnataka

title: Sharad Pawar slams CM Fadnavis for ‘ignoring’ plight of farmers, says ‘learn’ from Nepal’s situation
content: NCP-SP chief said CM Devendra Fadnavis should “learn” from Nepal’s political situation; he said his party will not be a “bystander” if the government does not address the State’s farm distress

title: Expert committee constituted for exploring the use of Artificial Intelligence in healthcare, says T.N. Health Minister Ma. Subramanian
content: The Tamil Nadu Medical Services Corporation is in the process of leveraging AI for the detection of tuberculosis by analysing X-rays. AI also has a role in early detection of cancer, he says

title: BJP will be wiped out from U.P. in 2027 Assembly polls, says Akhilesh
content: The Samajwadi Party chief says the State government is not running as per the Constitution and law and the BJP is working like a gang. The BJP government has ruined education, health, and law and order, he says.

title: Watch: Portraying Gandhi is a huge commitment: Pratik Gandhi | TIFF 2025
content: Film critic Meenakshi Shedde caught up with Hansal Mehta, producer Sameer Nair and lead actors Pratik Gandhi and Bhamini Oza in Toronto.

title: Truck runs over people in Indore, catches fire; two killed, several injured
content: Police officer says the truck driver has been detained; a video of the vehicle engulfed in fire on a busy road of the city also surfaced online

title: Aligarh court rejects police closure report against RJD spokesperson accused of tearing Manusmriti on live TV
content: The court’s order came on a protest petition filed by Bharat Tiwari, secretary of the Rashtriya Savarna Parishad

title: Government to release ₹600 crore for RTF; Federation calls off stir
content: The ₹600 crore being released is towards the already generated tokens and future payments will be streamlined to avoid accumulating dues, Deputy Chief Minister Bhatti Vikramarka said

title: 1 crore SVAMITVA property cards to be distributed to owners by March 2026
content: These legal ownership documents help reduce land disputes, enable villagers to access bank loans by monetising property, and strengthen panchayat-level governance through reliable property registers, says SVAMITVAA Director

title: Father raises suspicion over death of Jadavpur University student, police presses murder charges
content: Arnab Mondal, the father of the deceased third year English Honours student, says his daughter did not know how to swim, and asks why she would go to the edge of the waterbody on the campus around 10 p.m.

title: Kashmir’s fruit markets shut down over prolonged highway closure
content: Parcel train service launched to take apples from Valley to New Delhi; However, fruit growers say it is inadequate as huge stocks remain stranded on roads; CM blames Centre for delay in road work

title: Watch: ‘Old templates won’t work with China’, says T.S. Tirumurti on India-China ties
content: The launch of China: Indian Perspectives by The Hindu Publishing Group, curated by Ananth Krishnan, saw former Indian UN envoy T.S. Tirumurti speak on rethinking India’s China strategy. The event was also attended by N. Ram, Nirmala Lakshman, B. Santhanam, Suresh Nambath, Narayan Lakshman, and Stanly Johny.

title: UGC gets 8 weeks to include norms on tackling caste bias
content: The top court was hearing a plea filed by the mothers of Rohith Vemula and Payal Tadvi, who died by suicide after facing caste-based harassment at their colleges

title: Centre faces backlash for blocking Sikh pilgrims’ visit to Nankana Sahib in Pakistan
content: In communication to State governments, the Ministry of Home Affairs said, “taking into account the prevailing security scenario with Pakistan, it would not be possible to send Sikh pilgrims Jatha to Pakistan”

title: SC on anticipatory bail in caste crime
content: Supreme Court cancels anticipatory bail granted to a caste crime accused, upholding Section 18 of the SC/ST Act; the ruling reinforces protection for Dalit victims, bars pre-trial relief, and warns courts against conducting a ‘mini-trial’ at the bail stage

title: From October 1, only Aadhaar users can book reserved train tickets online during first 15 minutes
content: The tickets can be booked through the website of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) and its app

title: ED says it has secured over 94% conviction rate in PMLA cases
content: The central probe agency has set the target of achieving ₹15,000-crore restitution this financial year

title: Engineers play significant role in nation-building, say experts
content: They recall the historical contributions of engineers in irrigation projects and industrial growth of the country and make special references to projects such as Himayatsagar Dam and Srisailam Dam

title: Congress accuses government of ‘gifting’ 1,050 acres of land in Bihar’s Bhagalpur to Gautam Adani
content: At a press conference in Delhi, senior Congress leader Pawan Khera accused the government of withdrawing from the project in favour of Adani

title: Andhra Pradesh Governor says India lags behind in the participation of women in politics
content: The law to reserve 33% of the seats in State Assemblies and in the Lok Sabha for women would now enable their greater participation in policy-making and equitable governance, Justice (Retd) Nazeer said

title: Tamil Nadu Electricity Minister Sivasankar seeks a new comprehensive debt restructuring scheme for discoms
content: In his special address at the Group of Ministers meeting of the State Electricity Ministers in New Delhi, he also calls for special grants under the 16th Finance Commission. He says that in the next five to seven years, Tamil Nadu will need over ₹2,00,000 crore in investment across generation, transmission, and distribution

title: ED files charge sheet against Chhattisgarh ex-CM Bhupesh Baghel’s son Chaitanya
content: The case pertains to a loss of ₹2,161 crore to the State’s exchequer allegedly by a syndicate of senior bureaucrats, politicians, and excise department officials when Mr. Bhupesh was the Chief Minister.

title: Arpana’s long wait for a donor heart
content: Arpana from Nepal reached India six months ago and has been waiting for a donor heart for the past four months, having registered in the organ transplant waiting list

title: Insurance company officer sentenced to 10 years RI for misappropriating ₹5.3 crore in Dharwad
content: A CBI Special Court convicts Administrative Officer (Accounts) of Oriental Insurance Co. Ltd., Divisional Office, T. Pradeep of misappropriation

title: India gets licence to scour new part of Indian Ocean for precious metals
content: The government has signed a contract with International Seabed Authority to explore polymetallic sulphur nodules in the Carlsberg Ridge, a 3,00,000-sq km stretch that lies in the Indian Ocean

title: Tribals in Odisha tiger reserve allege they are being ‘fraudulently’ relocated
content: The Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change has ordered a probe into allegations that consent was ‘fraudulently’ obtained

title: SWR’s ‘Operation Meri Saheli’ reaches over 2 lakh solo women travellers in 2025
content: Launched in November 2020 by Indian Railways, the initiative focuses on providing assistance from the time of boarding until the completion of the journey

title: Madras High Court grants interim bail to Devanathan Yadav in Mylapore Hindu Permanent Fund case
content: Justice G. Jayachandran directs petitioner to mobilise ₹100 crore on his own and deposit it with the special court for TANPID cases in Chennai

title: Army launches rescue operations in flood-hit villages of Maharashtra
content: According to the Indian Army, responding to a request from the District Collector, Beed, the Indian Army launched Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) operations to rescue stranded residents.

title: Andhra Pradesh grapples with U.S. shrimp tariff, threatening aquaculture sector
content: The state continues to make strides in agriculture, industry, infrastructure, energy, tourism, and welfare, say officials

title: KPCC meeting outwardly muted over Mamkootathil’s attendance in Assembly
content: There appears to be a consensus among top leaders that the Congress MLA’s “surprise attendance” in the Assembly had helped the ruling front in directing the day’s news cycle away from issues plaguing the government.

title: Phillies clinch NL East with wild win vs. Dodgers
content: Kyle Schwarber, Weston Wilson and Bryce Harper homered, and the Phillies wrapped up their second straight NL East title with a thrilling 6-5 victory over the Dodgers on Monday night.

title: Brady shown in Raiders' coaching booth on MNF
content: Raiders minority owner Tom Brady was seen wearing a headset in the team's coaching booth during Monday's game vs. the Chargers.

title: Chargers LB Mack exits victory with elbow injury
content: Chargers linebacker Khalil Mack was ruled out of Monday's 20-9 win over the Raiders after sustaining an elbow injury in the first half that appeared to leave him in significant pain.

title: Commanders' Daniels has knee injury, status iffy
content: Commanders quarterback Jayden Daniels has a knee injury that has his status for Sunday's game against the Las Vegas Raiders in question.

title: Sources: Vikes' McCarthy (ankle) out 2-4 weeks
content: Vikings QB J.J. McCarthy is expected to miss two to four weeks with a high ankle sprain, sources told ESPN, and Carson Wentz is expected to start in his place.

title: LSU's Kelly apologizes to reporter for tirade
content: SU coach Brian Kelly apologized for snapping at a reporter following Saturday's 20-10 victory against Florida.

title: Astros' Alvarez set for MRI after injury at plate
content: Astros All-Star left fielder Yordan Alvarez left Monday's game against the Rangers because of a left ankle sprain.

title: Netflix: Crawford win vs. Canelo watched by 41M
content: Over 41 million viewers tuned in to Netflix for the undisputed super middleweight title fight Saturday night that saw Terence Crawford dethrone Canelo Alvarez, the streaming service announced Monday.

title: 🧐 Fantasy football free agent pickups
content: Highlighting available signal-callers after an injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 3.

title: Herbert controls game in Chargers' win over Raiders
content: After a slow start, the Chargers settled in, and the Raiders' QB Geno Smith threw three interceptions.

title: 'They have the most complete team': MLB insiders weigh in on October's teams to beat
content: In a year with no 100-game winners atop the standings, here's who those around the sport think could make a deep postseason run.

title: From dormant to dominant: Why Dominique Malonga could save the Storm
content: The Storm knew all along Dominique Malonga would emerge as a key part of their WNBA title hopes -- whether it's this year or in years to come.

title: Joe Burrow out with turf toe: What is it, and what will 3 months away mean for the QB, Bengals?
content: Jake Browning helped deliver a win to the Bengals on Sunday, but what's reasonable to expect from the backup?

title: Barnwell picks apart three wild Week 2 endings, from the Cowboys' big kick to the Jaguars' collapse
content: Bill Barnwell sorts through fourth-quarter fireworks in Giants-Cowboys, Broncos-Colts and Jaguars-Bengals.

title: Takeaways from every game: More Baker magic, Khalil Mack hurt in Chargers win
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game.

title: NFL Week 2's top performance? Check the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award leaderboard
content: Brandon Aubrey won the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award for Week 2's top player over for Jared Goff, Fred Warner and Malik Nabers.

title: Week 3 takeaways: Texas A&M's off to a hot start; UCLA ... not so much
content: After exciting wins and disappointing losses, we take a look at the biggest storylines following Week 3.

title: Inside the Warriors' stalemate with Jonathan Kuminga
content: Kuminga's future with the Warriors will determine how the team fills its remaining roster spots as training camp nears.

title: Buzz: Hunter plays both ways, Judkins debuts, Burrow injury and more from Sunday
content: Travis Hunter was pressed into extra DB service, the Bengals win with Jake Browning and more Sunday takeaways

title: Wrestlepalooza 2025: Date, time, channel, card, how to watch
content: ESPN is excited to present the first annual Wrestlepalooza on Saturday. Check out how to watch John Cena, Seth Rollins and other WWE stars.

title: How Karina Tovar, the NFL's first Latina ref, became a trailblazer
content: To kick off Hispanic Heritage Month, the daughter of Mexican immigrants discussed how her love of football turned into a pioneering journey.

title: Champions League storylines: Will Arsenal win it all, PSG repeat, Barca rebound?
content: The UEFA Champions League kicks into high gear on Tuesday. But who are the favorites? How about the fashionable outsiders? Mark Ogden weighs in on the big clubs and talking points.

title: Man City's big men step up vs. Man United, lucky Liverpool, Madrid's ref déjà vu, more
content: Man City's "big men" came up big in Sunday's derby win, Liverpool get lucky (again) and Real Madrid have more complaints about the referees in LaLiga, as Gab Marcotti explains the weekend.

title: Philadelphia's virtual jabs at Kansas City lead NFL Week 2 trolls
content: The San Francisco 49ers also made sure to poke fun at the New Orleans Saints after winning on the road, leading Week 2's NFL trolls.

title: Fantasy Baseball Forecaster for Week 25: Playoffs Week 3, Sept. 15-21
content: Set your lineups for the week ahead in fantasy baseball with our forecaster, which features pitcher rankings, hitter ratings, schedule observations and more.

title: MLS: Did Müller, Vancouver just leapfrog the league's best?
content: Thomas Müller and Vancouver trounced Philly 7-0, so was it enough to dethrone the leaders of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid, Barcelona eye Stiller
content: Both Real Madrid and Barcelona are looking at a move for Stuttgart midfielder Angelo Stiller. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 3 Dead, Many Vehicles Buried As Landslides Hit Himachal's Mandi, Shimla
content: Heavy overnight rain triggered floods and landslides in Himachal Pradesh, killing a family of three as debris from an adjoining cliff slid onto their house, causing it to collapse, in the Mandi district.

title: Houses, IT Park Submerged As Heavy Rain Triggers Cloudburst In Dehradun
content: A cloudburst struck Uttarakhand's Dehradun on Monday night due to heavy rainfall submerging sveral houses in Tapovan and causing severe waterlogging in Sahastradhara and the IT Park area.

title: "Most Degenerate Newspaper": Trump Sues New York Times For $15 Billion
content: US President Donald Trump, on Monday (local time), is planning to sue American daily The New York Times over its coverage linked to disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Speeding Car Crushes 2 Brothers Walking Home From School, Cop Was At Wheel
content: Days after rash driving claimed a senior government officer's life in Delhi, two brothers have been killed in neighbouring Haryana - this time, an enforcer of law is the accused.

title: Caught On Camera: Woman's Narrow Escape As Wall Collapses In Ranchi
content: In a viral video, a woman is seen tiptoeing through a waterlogged alley when a wall towards her right falls flat on the ground.

title: Row After Union Minister Stopped From Entering VVIP Zone During PM's Kolkata Visit
content: Union Minister of State for Education Sukanta Majumdar was on Monday denied entry into the VVIP zone of the Kolkata airport while attempting to bid farewell to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

title: "Khada Ho, Khada Ho": Nitish Kumar Orders Standing Ovation For PM Modi
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, once a harsh critic of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, asked a gathering in Bihar's Purnea to give him a standing ovation for the development projects the Centre is implementing in the state.

title: Telangana Colleges End Strike After Assurance To Release Rs 600 Crore Dues
content: Telangana government has assured to release Rs 600 crore in pending fee reimbursement dues immediately and another Rs 600 crore in monthly instalments without setting a timeline.

title: "Was Preventable If...": Team Trump On Indian Man's Beheading In US
content: Yordanis Cobos Martinez, a 37-year-old undocumented immigrant in the US, who is accused of killing an Indian motel manager in Dallas, Texas, last week, is now facing deportation.

title: Team Trump's 'Visa' Warning To Those "Celebrating" Charlie Kirk's Killing
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio has warned that the Trump administration would revoke US visas of immigrants who "glorify" political killings like that of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

title: Video: US Strikes Venezuelan Drug Vessel, Trump Says It "Posed A Threat"
content: The strike was carried out nearly two weeks after another military strike on what the Trump administration said was a drug-carrying speedboat from Venezuela that killed 11.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Waqf Act: When BJP Indulged In A Mockery Of Procedure
content: The passing of the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 in Parliament was marked by chicanery and evasive tactics. Even a casual observer of Parliament can outline how the BJP-led coalition is making a mockery of parliamentary procedure.

title: Brazil's Amazon Rainforest Lost Area The Size Of Spain In 40 Years: Study
content: The Amazon was approaching a "point of no return" of 20 to 25 percent vegetation loss at which it "ceases to sustain itself as a rainforest," said Bruno Ferreira, a researcher at the MapBiomas monitoring platform.

title: Heavy Bombing In Gaza City After US Secretary Rubio Backs Israel
content: Israel heavily bombarded Gaza City on Tuesday, witnesses told AFP, after US Secretary of State Marco Rubio backed Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's new offensive there and its stated goal of eradicating Hamas.

title: US Vows To 'Disrupt, Destroy' Leftist Groups After Charlie Kirk's Death
content: White House Deputy Chief of Staff Stephen Miller said Charlie Kirk's final message to him called for a coordinated effort against unnamed left-wing groups accused of promoting violence.

title: "I Would Not Be Vice President If It Weren't For Charlie Kirk": JD Vance
content: JD Vance said while hosting Charlie Kirk's radio show that he is "desperate" for national unity after the conservative political activist's killing but that finding common ground with people who celebrated the killing of his friend is impossible.

title: Charlie Kirk's Killer Wrote 'Opportunity To Take Him Out' Note Before Murder
content: The suspect accused of murdering right-wing activist Charlie Kirk in Utah told another person in a text message before the shooting that he planned to kill Kirk, FBI Director Kash Patel said on Monday.

title: DKS announces plan to open new town planning college
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Delhi BMW crash: Watch for dad, earrings for mom — birthday gifts that weren't to be
content: Navjot Singh, a deputy secretary in the finance ministry, tragically died in an accident near Dhaula Kuan. His wife, Sandeep Kaur, was critically injured. The incident occurred just before their son, Navnoor Singh's birthday. Navjot Singh had a distinguished career, representing India at international forums. He was remembered as a dedicated family man and a passionate individual with diverse interests.

title: Dehradun cloudburst: Scary visuals of flash floods emerge
content: A cloudburst in Dehradun triggered flash floods, causing significant damage and disrupting traffic. A bridge collapsed on the Dehradun-Haridwar highway, and the Sahastradhara river overflowed, damaging shops. The Tamsa River flooded the Tapkeshwar Mahadev temple premises, prompting rescue operations by SDRF and police. Authorities are on high alert, monitoring the situation.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Leftist ideology the motive? 10 key points about Tyler Robinson
content: Tyler Robinson is accused of assassinating conservative activist Charlie Kirk in Utah. Robinson allegedly confessed, citing irreconcilable hatred, and left a chilling note. Investigators are exploring his radicalized leftist ideology, online activity, and potential accomplices. The case has ignited national mourning, political repercussions, and security concerns, with prosecutors seeking the death penalty.

title: Raid on Assam civil servant tied to ‘illegal transfer of Hindus’ land’
content: Assam bureaucrat Nupur Bora, a 2019-batch ACS officer, has been arrested for alleged corruption involving illegal land transfers in Barpeta, where the government is targeting suspected Bangladeshi settlers. Raids on her properties revealed nearly ₹1 crore in cash and valuable jewelry. CM Sarma stated that Bora was under investigation for transferring land to a specific community and hoarding disproportionate assets.

title: ITR filing: Why was due date extended by a day? What we know
content: Amid a record surge in Income Tax Return (ITR) filings, the government extended the deadline for Assessment Year 2025-26 by a day, pushing it to September 16, 2025, as taxpayers reported portal access issues. Over 7.3 crore returns were filed by the original deadline.

title: Apple iOS 26 released: 26 features of Apple’s biggest software update of 2025
content: Apple's iOS 26 update introduces a revolutionary Liquid Glass design, transforming the iPhone interface with translucent elements. This update brings futuristic features like real-time language translation in calls and enhanced visual intelligence. Users can also enjoy customizable app icons, improved messaging features, and a centralized gaming hub, all while maintaining the familiar iOS experience.

title: Asia Cup: Who is Pycroft, the match referee that PCB want removed
content: Following India's victory over Pakistan in the Asia Cup, a controversy arose when the Indian team refused to shake hands, dedicating their win to armed forces after a terror attack. The PCB filed a complaint with the ICC, alleging the match referee Andy Pycroft instructed captains against shaking hands.

title: 'Gaza is burning': Video shows building razed to rubble as Israel begins major offensive
content: Following US Secretary of State Marco Rubio's pledge of unwavering support, Israel intensified airstrikes on Gaza City, resulting in widespread destruction and casualties. Defense Minister Israel Katz declared "Gaza is burning" as the military prepares for a new offensive, urging civilians to evacuate.

title: Thrashing, protest, threats: How India vs Pak has played out - a blow-by-blow account
content: India dominated Pakistan in the Asia Cup clash on Sunday, securing a 7-wicket victory. Suryakumar Yadav dedicated the win to the armed forces and Pahalgam terror attack victims. Post-match, India's team skipped the customary handshake, and Pakistan's coach expressed disappointment.

title: Google’s Nano Banana AI: Saree edits take over Insta; 5 mistakes to avoid
content: The internet is abuzz with the Google Gemini Nano Banana AI saree trend, enabling users to transform selfies into 90s Bollywood-style portraits. These viral edits feature chiffon sarees, grainy textures, and golden-hour lighting, achieved through precise AI prompts.

title: Sandalwood scam: Kannada actor Upendra, wife targeted; friends cheated via WhatsApp
content: Sandalwood stars Upendra Rao and Priyanka Upendra fell victim to a sophisticated digital scam after their phones were hacked by fraudsters impersonating a courier service. The scammers then sent messages to the couple's contacts requesting urgent financial assistance, leading some, including their son, to transfer money.

title: India-US trade deal: First in-person talks since Trump imposed 50% tariffs; what to expect
content: India and the US are set to resume trade talks, the first since the US imposed tariffs on New Delhi over Russian oil purchases. The meeting aims to establish a roadmap for addressing trade matters, focusing on issues like agricultural import duties and commodity procurement.

title: Charlie Kirk killing: Did Robinson confess? Kash Patel cites DNA link & a threatening text
content: FBI Director Kash Patel revealed a crucial development in the Charlie Kirk assassination case, stating that investigators recovered a text thread where Tyler Robinson expressed his intent to kill Kirk out of "hatred." Forensic evidence confirms Robinson's DNA on the firearm and a screwdriver. Robinson also apparently confessed to the crime on Discord before his arrest.

title: Google Gemini Nano Banana: Experts warn about AI tool's safety risk
content: Google's Gemini Nano Banana AI tool has sparked viral trends like 3D figurines and Bollywood-style saree transformations. While Google implements watermarks for AI-generated content, experts warn about potential privacy and security risks, including data misuse and scams. Authorities advise caution when sharing personal information and using unofficial apps.

title: 'Understandable to tariff India but...': Zelenskyy urges US action on Russia; makes big Putin claim
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy suggested that Washington consider tariffs on nations like India for buying Russian oil, but cautioned against delaying action against Vladimir Putin, asserting that delays benefit Moscow. He criticized Putin's perceived gains from a recent summit with Donald Trump, emphasizing that Putin is actively trying to manipulate his way out of global isolation.

title: Himachal Pradesh rain fury: Flood wreaks havoc in Dharampur; 3 dead in landslides
content: Heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district triggered severe destruction, particularly in Dharampur town, where flooding swept away vehicles and submerged the bus stand. A landslide in Nihri resulted in three deaths, with rescue operations ongoing. The monsoon's impact has been devastating, causing numerous fatalities, substantial economic losses, and widespread damage to infrastructure, housing, and agriculture across the state.

title: Sunjay Kapur's wife makes 1st public appearance amid his Rs 30K cr inheritance row
content: Priya Sachdev Kapur, amidst a legal battle over her late husband Sunjay Kapur's estate, has stepped into his business legacy. Attending the ACMA Annual Convention in Delhi, she was also inducted into ACMA’s Executive Committee for 2025-26. Sunjay's children, Samaira and Kiaan, are contesting his will, alleging Priya altered it to exclude them from their inheritance.

title: Asia Cup: India qualify for Super 4s; what happens if Pakistan pull out?
content: Pakistan Cricket Board is in a standoff with the International Cricket Council. This follows a handshake controversy with the Indian team. PCB threatens to boycott their Asia Cup match against UAE. They demand the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft. If Pakistan withdraws, they will be eliminated. India has already qualified for the Super 4s.

title: 'Degenerate newspaper': Trump files $15bn lawsuit against NYT; calls it 'radical left' mouthpiece
content: Donald Trump has initiated a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times, accusing the paper of being a Democratic mouthpiece engaged in a long-term smear campaign. Trump claims their endorsement of Kamala Harris was an illegal campaign contribution.

title: Life on Mars: Nasa rover discovers strongest sign of life on Mars; all you need to know
content: NASA's Perseverance rover has detected compelling evidence of potential past life on Mars within Jezero Crater. The rover's analysis of a mudstone core revealed minerals and textures indicative of microbial activity, including vivianite and greigite. While not definitive proof, these findings represent a significant step in the search for life beyond Earth, pending further analysis of returned samples.

title: UK PM vs Musk: Starmer slams Tesla CEO's 'fight or die' remark; calls him 'hostile'
content: Keir Starmer's office has strongly condemned Elon Musk for his "dangerous and inflammatory language" at a far-right protest in London, attended by approximately 150,000 people. Musk called for the dissolution of Parliament and warned of impending violence. Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood also criticized Musk, labeling him a "hostile billionaire" for undermining British democracy, following clashes that injured 26 police officers.

title: Harvard study reveals dangers of late breakfast: Here's what you need to know
content: A recent study reveals that delaying breakfast is associated with a higher risk of mortality and various health issues like fatigue and depression. Researchers found that for each hour breakfast was delayed, the risk of death increased by 8-11%. Prioritizing earlier, consistent mealtimes and a nutritious breakfast is crucial for overall well-being and longevity, especially as we age.

title: Car driven by cop mows down 2 schoolkids in Haryana's Palwal
content: In Palwal's Hathin, a tragic incident occurred on Kot-Uttawar road where a police constable's car struck three children returning from school, resulting in the deaths of Ayaan (13) and Ahsaan (9). Arjaan (7) sustained severe injuries and is receiving advanced treatment.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens near 25,100; BSE Sensex up around 70 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was near 25,100, BSE Sensex was up over 70 points.

title: ‘Expect Europeans to do their share now’: US holds back on China tariffs
content: US treasury secretary Scott Bessent stated that the Trump administration will hold off on new tariffs on Chinese goods related to Russian oil purchases, pending substantial tariff actions from European countries. Bessent emphasised the need for Europe to increase pressure on Moscow's oil revenues, suggesting significant tariffs on buyers of Russian oil to effectively cut off Moscow's income source.

title: Fire & screams: Truck ploughs through traffic in Indore
content: A speeding truck in Indore tragically killed at least two people and injured several others near the Bada Ganpati temple. The uncontrolled vehicle struck pedestrians and vehicles before catching fire. Lakshmikant Soni, a Medicaps University professor, was among the deceased.

title: After handshake drama, Team India back to business in Dubai
content: Amidst controversy and PCB threats, India refocuses on cricket, securing their spot in the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4s after UAE's victory over Oman. The upcoming UAE-Pakistan match becomes a virtual knockout, crucial for Pakistan after their defeat to India.

title: Jayden Daniels injury update: Commanders' QB diagnosed with knee sprain
content: Washington Commanders' quarterback Jayden Daniels suffered a knee sprain during their Week 2 loss against the Green Bay Packers, casting doubt on his availability for the upcoming Week 3 game against the Las Vegas Raiders. While the MRI revealed no severe ligament damage, Daniels' participation hinges on his ability to demonstrate pain-free movement and agility in practice.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Prestige, citing a breakout from a triangle pattern and positive momentum indicators, with a target of Rs 1720. GMR Airport is also a buy, according to Mehta, as it has broken out of a bullish consolidation pattern and is expected to reach Rs 97, supported by its 20-day moving average.

title: Ganguly makes honest confession: 'I stopped watching India vs Pak after just 15 overs'
content: Sourav Ganguly dismissed the India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash as one-sided, preferring to watch the Manchester derby. He cited a decline in Pakistan's team quality, stating the match no longer holds the competitive edge it once did. Ganguly also addressed the handshake controversy, emphasizing the need to end terrorism globally while deflecting questions about the players' actions to Suryakumar Yadav.

title: Delhi’s sex ratio dips to 920, falling for 4th year
content: Delhi's sex ratio at birth has declined for the fourth consecutive year, reaching 920 females per 1,000 males in 2024, raising concerns about illegal prenatal sex determination. The city also experienced a decrease in registered births alongside an increase in deaths.

title: Charlie Kirk’s influence: How Trump ally's views are changing NFL fan culture & game-day atmosphere
content: In 2025, the NFL navigates a cultural shift as conservative commentator Charlie Kirk's messages resonate with specific fan groups, emphasizing patriotism and tradition. This influence sparks debates among fans, altering the game-day experience with visible displays of support and contrasting views on political neutrality in sports. The NFL now reflects America's broader cultural divisions.

title: Nasa warning: 2025 FA22 asteroid nears Earth; bigger than Qutub Minar
content: Asteroid 2025 FA22, significantly larger than Delhi's Qutub Minar, will make a close approach to Earth on September 18, 2025. While NASA confirms it poses no collision threat, its size and proximity offer a valuable opportunity for scientific study. Traveling at approximately 24,127 miles per hour, this flyby allows researchers to refine orbital models and improve planetary defense strategies.

title: NBA Trade Rumors: Warriors eye $239.9M Grizzlies superstar; Kuminga contract troubles
content: The Golden State Warriors are reportedly considering a significant trade with the Memphis Grizzlies, offering young talent and draft picks for Jaren Jackson Jr. This move aims to bolster the Warriors' championship aspirations during Stephen Curry's prime. Memphis, in turn, would gain assets to rebuild around Ja Morant, gaining financial flexibility for the future.

title: Chiefs' heiress Gracie Hunt’s billionaire lifestyle — lavish mansion, private jets, old money wealth, and more
content: Despite the Kansas City Chiefs' recent setbacks, heiress Gracie Hunt remains optimistic. Daughter of billionaire owners Clark and Tavia Hunt, Gracie lives a life of luxury, often showcased on social media. Raised in a Dallas mansion and frequently traveling by private jet, Gracie's family wealth stems from her great-grandfather, oil tycoon Haroldson Lafayette Hunt.

title: Opposition taking out yatras to save 'illegals' in Bihar: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi raised concerns about demographic changes in Bihar's Seemanchal region, criticizing the opposition for supporting infiltrators for vote-bank politics. He promised to address the issue through the demography mission. Modi inaugurated projects worth ₹40,541 crore, including Purnia airport's terminal, and flagged off new trains.

content: the WNBA playoffs are finally here . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Game 1 and Game 3 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: NWSL: Jaedyn Shaw has supercharged Gotham FC
content: our writers studied the action from across Matchday 20 to come up with this week's order of all 14 teams in the league . the first team to hit the 50-point mark in 2025, the Kansas City Current climbed to that total on the back of a scoreless draw with the Washington Spirit .

title: From reassurance to accountability, who said what in Week 2?
content: Philadelphia Eagles vs. Kansas City Chiefs Game Highlights (1:00) NFL Week 2 saw plenty of close endings and wild moments that produced memorable quips. Along with a rematch of Super Bowl LIX between the  Philadelphia Eagles  and  Kansas City Chiefs , the  Detroit Lions  faced one of their former coaches in Chicago, the  Dallas Cowboys  picked up their first win and the  Miami Dolphins  continued to struggle. But following each respective matchup, players and coaches were open and vocal in their reactions. Can you correctly guess who said what? See how locked in you were during Week 2 below:

title: Virginia Tech fires Brent Pry: Top candidates, transfers and recruits to watch
content: the Virginia Tech Hokies fired coach Brent Pry after a 0-3 start to the season . Pry was supposed to represent a return to the Frank Beamer glory years in blacksburg . but a bowl game in 2023 and a faceplant to start this season closed the curtain for Pry .

title: DeShaun Foster is out at UCLA; here's who could take over the Bruins
content: alum deShaun Foster was elevated late in the 2023-24 coaching carousel . the school fired Foster after an 0-3 start in which the Bruins were outscored 108-43 . he is a former assistant and standout running back in the NFL .

title: NFL Week 3 betting: Odds, lines and totals for every game
content: the Miami Dolphins host the Buffalo Bills on "Thursday Night Football" on tuesday . a matchup of undefeated teams will feature the New York Giants and the Kansas City Chiefs . the team is the biggest favorite on the week 3 slate .

title: Baker Mayfield leads late drive as Buccaneers stun Texans in Houston
content: the Buccaneers beat the Texans 20-19 on "Monday Night Football" Baker Mayfield scored a game-winning touchdown drive with two minutes to go . he was flushed from the pocket and could not connect with rookie wideout Emeka Egbuka .

title: What has gone wrong for the Mets? Breaking down their second-half woes
content: the new york Mets beat the Milwaukee Brewers 5-2 in the wild-card series . a 3-run walk-off homer in the 10th inning was the biggest for the Mets in their past nine games . it wasn't the biggest hit of Pete Alonso's career, but his homer was certainly the biggest .
